did.physloc: Materials are stored off-site, and will require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.
did.abstract: Hugh Wallace "Wally" Walthall (1948 - 2015) was a local D.C. poet, actor, playwright, and publisher. The collection contains typed and handwritten poems, published works of poetry in monographs, anthologies, and serials. Some of the publications are journals that include poems by Mr. Walthall. These materials date from the 1960s through the 2000s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains typed and handwritten poems, published works of poetry in monographs, anthologies, and serials. Some of the publications are journals that include poems by Mr. Walthall. These materials date from the 1960s through the 2000s.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Hugh Wallace "Wally" Walthall (1948 - 2015) was a local D.C. poet, actor, playwright, and publisher.

Poet, Actor, Playwright, and Publisher. He moved to Washington DC in the late 1960s. His poems have been published in Washington Review, Shenandoah, American Review, Gargoyle, and the G.W. Review. Mr. Walthall sometimes published under the name Steamboat Jones. In 1978, Mr. Walthall's book of poetry, ladidah, was published by Ithaca House.

Mr. Walthall was the founding publisher/editor, along with Richard Flynn, of Sultan of Swat (SOS) Books, which in the 1980s published books of poetry by local D.C. area poets. SOS Books was financed by a small class action settlement that Mr. Walthall was awarded for having been the subject of an illegal arrest during an anti-war protest. He was also the publisher/editor of the Journal of Pomposity, Shoddy Thinking and of Sex with Frankenstein, each of which lasted one issue. In the 1990s he began studying acting at the Studio Theatre Acting Conservatory and appearing in plays at the Studio Theatre SecondStage. His play, "Jean Stafford's Theory of the Lindbergh Kidnapping", was staged there. Mr. Walthall worked at the library of the Walter Reed Hospital retiring when the library closed in the early 2000s.
Mr. Walthall was born February 12, 1948 in Roswell, New Mexico and as a young a child moved with his family to Deep Creek Lake, Maryland. He died in Washington D.C. on November 1, 2015.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection is unprocessed and will take more time to use for research. Please ask staff for assistance.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not yet been arranged.
